Buses Replace Weekend Trains btwn Pt. Jeff. & Huntington, May 30-31

This weekend, buses replace trains btwn Huntington & Pt Jefferson as new ties are installed. See http://bit.ly/1d0mKKI for details. E/B customers board buses at Huntington for stations Greenlawn thru Pt. Jeff. W/B customers board buses at stations Pt Jeff thru Greenlawn and transfer at Huntington to trains for points west. Service intervals reduced on the Port Jeff Branch. Please allow for add'l travel time.

Planned work: At the Queens Midtown Tunnel, the South tube will be closed from 10:30 pm May 15 through 05:30 am June 1. One lane will be open in each direction for cars and buses. During this time Queens-bound motorists should enter the tunnel at 34th Street between Second and Third avenues. Manhattan bound motorists can exit normally, or use the Marginal tunnel exit to 38th Street and then continue on to Second Avenue. The 34th Street and Second Avenue ramps will be closed to traffic exiting in Manhattan. All other commercial traffic must use alternate routes

Q Line – Weekday Planned Service Changes

10 AM to 3 PM, Mon and Tue, Jun 1 – 2 Q service operates in two sections: 1. Between Ditmars Blvd and Brighton Beach 2. Between Brighton Beach and Stillwell Av, every 16 minutes. Transfer at Brighton Beach to continue your trip. 9:45 AM to 3 PM, Wed to Fri, Jun 3 – 5 Coney Island-bound Q trains run express from Prospect Park to Kings Hwy. Note: Manhattan-bound B trains run local from Kings Hwy to Prospect Park. These service changes affect one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.

Bicycle permits are required to bring bikes onboard LIRR trains, with the exception of folding bikes. Bike permits can be purchased for $5 at LIRR station ticket windows or onboard trains. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for details on bike restrictions.

Starting Monday, June 1st, the escalator at Amityville Station, along with the center staircase, will be closed to accommodate the construction of a new, wider escalator. For platform access, customers should utilize the staircases on the east and west ends of Amityville station. The work is expected to be completed by mid-November.

Bike Restrictions for Summer Montauk Branch Trains

Permits are required to bring bikes on LIRR trains. Specific restrictions apply for bikes on Montauk Br. trains in the summer. No bikes allowed on Friday E/B departures from NYC between 1-8PM. No bikes permitted on Sunday W/B NYC arrivals between 4:30 PM-7:30 PM. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for other restrictions.

Bicycle permits are required to bring bikes onboard LIRR trains, with the exception of folding bikes. Bike permits can be purchased for $5 at LIRR station ticket windows or onboard trains. See http://bit.ly/1biGIhu for details on bike restrictions.

A service operates between 207 St and Lefferts Blvd. Shuttle trains operate between Euclid Av and Howard Beach-JFK Airport only. Free shuttle buses run between 88 St and Beach 90 St, stopping at Rockaway Blvd (88 St-bound only) and Broad Channel. Rockaway Park shuttle trains operate between Rockaway Park/Beach 116 St and Far Rockaway/Mott Av. For service to the Rockaways, take free shuttle buses from 88 St to Beach 90 St, where shuttle trains are available to either Far Rockaway or Rockaway Park. For service to Aqueduct-North Conduit Av and Howard Beach-JFK Airport, transfer at Euclid Av to a shuttle train. UPDATED: QUEENS MIDTOWN TUNNEL - MANHATTAN BOUND

Planned work: At the Queens Midtown Tunnel, the South tube will be closed from 10:30 pm May 15 through 05:30 am May 18. One lane will be open in each direction for cars and buses.During this time Queens-bound motorists should enter the tunnel at 34th Street between Second and Third avenues. Manhattan bound motorists can exit normally, or use the Marginal tunnel exit to 38th Street and then continue on to Second Avenue. The 34th Street and Second Avenue ramps will be closed to traffic exiting in Manhattan. All other commercial traffic must use alternate routes.
New Canaan Branch service is currently experiencing delays of up to 15 minutes. Please listen for announcements at your station.
New West-of-Hudson Schedules Effective Sunday, May 17

The next West-of-Hudson schedule change goes into effect on Sunday, May 17, bringing minor adjustments to improve service.On the Port Jervis Line: To improve connections made at Secaucus Junction, the 6:05 AM train from Port Jervis will depart 3 minutes later at 6:08 AM, arrive at Secaucus Junction 6 minutes later at 8:15 AM, and arrive Hoboken 5 minutes later at 8:26 AM.Look for minor changes to other AM Peak trains intended to improve reliability and better reflect actual performance.On the Pascack Valley Line: Minor adjustments are being made on several trains to better reflect actual performance.On all lines: The new schedules contain a number of minor changes to accommodate the summer construction season and track maintenance programs.New timetables will be available at Hoboken Terminal and Secaucus Junction, or online at www.njtransit.com and on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1pqFXEe

New West-of-Hudson Schedules Effective Sunday, May 17

The next West-of-Hudson schedule change goes into effect on Sunday, May 17, bringing minor adjustments to improve service. On the Port Jervis Line: To improve connections made at Secaucus Junction, the 6:05 AM train from Port Jervis will depart 3 minutes later at 6:08 AM, arrive at Secaucus Junction 6 minutes later at 8:15 AM, and arrive Hoboken 5 minutes later at 8:26 AM. Look for minor changes to other AM Peak trains intended to improve reliability and better reflect actual performance. On the Pascack Valley Line: Minor adjustments are being made on several trains to better reflect actual performance. On all lines: The new schedules contain a number of minor changes to accommodate the summer construction season and track maintenance programs. New timetables will be available at Hoboken Terminal and Secaucus Junction, or online at www.njtransit.com and on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1pqFXEe

Special Timetables for ALL Branches THIS WEEKEND, May 16-17

THIS WEEKEND, Sat. & Sun. May 16-17, ALL LIRR branches will have special timetables due to the Ellison Ave. Bridge Demolition work. While the greatest impact on train service will be on the Port Jefferson and Ronkonkoma branches, ALL LIRR branches will be affected with revised departure and arrival times for weekend trains. Please see the special May 16-17 weekend timetable for your branch. For additional info on this weekend's work and its impact on service see http://bit.ly/1KTtohI.
Ronkonkoma Br. Service Affected THIS WEEKEND, May 16-17

THIS WEEKEND, Sat. & Sun. May 16-17, Ronkonkoma Branch trains will be diverted to the Babylon & Central branches for service to/from stations Farmingdale thru Ronkonkoma from 7 AM-midnight due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. Other times, buses replace trains between Mineola & Hicksville. Expect up to 44 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable & addn'l info at http://bit.ly/1KTtohI.
Pt. Jefferson Br. Service Affected THIS WEEKEND, May 16-17

THIS WEEKEND, Sat. May 16 thru Sun. May 17, buses replace trains on Pt. Jefferson Br. between Mineola & Hicksville due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. Half-hourly service is reduced to hourly between Penn Sta. & Huntington; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff is reduced to 2-hourly intervals. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable and additional info at http://bit.ly/1KTtohI.

Upper Hudson AM Peak Opposite-Side Boarding May 11-29

Opposite-side boarding will take place during weekday AM Peak at Cold Spring, Garrison, Manitou, Peekskill and Cortlandt stations from Monday, May 11-Friday, May 29. • Inbound trains departing Poughkeepsie (to Grand Central) from approximately 4 AM - 10 AM will arrive on Track 1 at these stations. • Outbound trains heading to Poughkeepsie from approximately 7 AM - 10 AM will arrive on Track 2 at these stations. These changes are to accommodate track work in this segment of our territory. At all other times of the day, and on weekends, trains will operate on regular tracks. We appreciate your patience during this service change.

Ronkonkoma Br. Service Affected NEXT WEEKEND, May 16-17

NEXT WEEKEND, Sat. & Sun. May 16-17, Ronkonkoma Branch trains will be diverted to the Babylon & Central branches for service to/from stations Farmingdale thru Ronkonkoma from 7 AM-midnight due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. Other times, buses replace trains between Mineola & Hicksville. Expect up to 44 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable & addn'l info at http://bit.ly/1KTtohI
Pt. Jefferson Br. Service Affected NEXT WEEKEND, May 16-17

NEXT WEEKEND, Sat. May 16 thru Sun. May 17, buses replace trains on Pt. Jeff. Br. between Mineola & Hicksville due to Ellison Ave. Bridge work. Half-hourly service is reduced to hourly between Penn Sta. & Huntington; service between Huntington & Pt. Jeff is reduced to 2-hourly intervals. Expect up to 60 mins. addn'l travel time. See special timetable and additional info at http://bit.ly/1KTtohI

Upper Hudson AM Peak Opposite-Side Boarding May 11-29

Opposite-side boarding will take place during weekday AM Peak at Cold Spring, Garrison, Manitou, Peekskill and Cortlandt stations from Monday, May 11-Friday, May 29. • Inbound trains departing Poughkeepsie (to Grand Central) from approximately 4 AM - 10 AM will arrive on Track 1 at these stations. • Outbound trains heading to Poughkeepsie from approximately 7 AM - 10 AM will arrive on Track 2 at these stations. These changes are to accommodate track work in this segment of our territory. At all other times of the day, and on weekends, trains will operate on regular tracks. We appreciate your patience during this service change.

Waterbury Branch: Temporary Devon Transfer Opens May 4 to Accommodate Bridge Repairs

Waterbury Branch: Temporary Devon Transfer Opens May 4 to Accommodate Bridge Repairs To accommodate the final phase of a $5.8 million priority-repair project on Devon Bridge, a new, temporary transfer point --Devon Transfer--has been built where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet. Track 3, also known as the inbound local track, will be out of service continuously for six months while the work occurs. As a result, starting Monday, May 4th: • All Waterbury Branch customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at the new Devon Transfer location, cross the walkway, and wait for a train on Track 1, also known as the inbound express track. • Waterbury Branch customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train connection to New Haven. • Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at the Devon Transfer and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See more details at http://bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See

Waterbury Branch: Temporary Devon Transfer Opens May 4 to Accommodate Bridge Repairs

To accommodate the final phase of a $5.8 million priority-repair project on Devon Bridge, a new, temporary transfer point --Devon Transfer--has been built where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet. Track 3, also known as the inbound local track, will be out of service continuously for six months while the work occurs. As a result, starting Monday, May 4th: • All Waterbury Branch customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at the new Devon Transfer location, cross the walkway, and wait for a train on Track 1, also known as the inbound express track. • Waterbury Branch customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train connection to New Haven. • Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at the Devon Transfer and board a waiting train for Waterbury. To accommodate the final phase of a $5.8 million priority-repair project on Devon Bridge, a new, temporary transfer point --Devon Transfer--has been built where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet. Track 3, also known as the inbound local track, will be out of service continuously for six months while the work occurs. As a result, starting Monday, May 4th: • All Waterbury Branch customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at the new Devon Transfer location, cross the walkway, and wait for a train on Track 1, also known as the inbound express track. • Waterbury Branch customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train connection to New Haven. • Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at the Devon Transfer and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See more details at http://bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See train times/schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk Work will occur during dayligh

If You See Something, Say Something

There are 16 million eyes in the city. We're counting on all of them to help improve security. Please remain vigilant by reporting unattended packages. If you see something, say something. Tell the MTA Police, an MTA employee or call 1 (888) NYC-SAFE (1-888-692-7233).

Waterbury Branch: Temporary Devon Transfer Opens May 4 to Accommodate Bridge Repairs

To accommodate the final phase of a $5.8 million priority-repair project on Devon Bridge, a new, temporary transfer point --Devon Transfer--has been built where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet. Track 3, also known as the inbound local track, will be out of service continuously for six months while the work occurs. As a result, starting Monday, May 4th: • All Waterbury Branch customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at the new Devon Transfer location, cross the walkway, and wait for a train on Track 1, also known as the inbound express track. • Waterbury Branch customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train connection to New Haven. • Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at the Devon Transfer and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See more details at http://bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See train times/schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk Work will occur during daylight hours se
